HuffmanTree

Method Detail

constructTree

public void constructTree()
Using the frequency heap, this function sets the connections between nodes, creating the binary tree. To do it, this method removes smallest two items from the tree, creates a parent for both of them, and adds it\ to the heap. At every iteration, the number of items in the heap decreases by one. When there's only one item in the heap, the method returns. This last item in the heap is the root of the binary tree.

getCode

public boolean getCode(E e,
                       int[] code,
                       int[] length)
This is a wrapper metod for decoding an item 'e'

Parameters:
e - The item to be decoded
code - The binary code of the item
length - The number of bits for the code
Returns:
True if the code is found in the tree.

decode

public E decode(int bit)
Decodes the input bit stream. Every time this method is called, the input 'bit' value is appended to the stored decoding bitstream, and the bitstream is checked against the tree. If a match occurs, the bitstream is reset and the item is returned.

Parameters:
bit - Represents the bit in the code.
Returns:
The decoded item if decode succeeds, null otherwise.

public void addFrequency(E e,

Adds a value-frequency pair to the frequency heap

Parameters:
e - The type of values.
prb - The frequency of the value.
